pageProps.body:
Rules of Differentiation

Notation

  • Prime notation
    • f′(x)f\prime (x)f′(x)
    • y′y\primey′
    • f′f\primef′
    • Most common
  • Leibniz notation
    • dydx\frac{dy}{dx}dxdy​
    • ddx[y]\frac{d}{dx} [y]dxd​[y]
  • Dot notation
    • y˙(t)\dot{y}(t)y˙​(t)
    • y′(t)y\prime(t)y′(t)
  • Differentials
    • Dx(f(x))D_x (f(x))Dx​(f(x))

Constant rule

  • Let f(x)=cf(x)=cf(x)=c where ccc is a real number, then dydx[c]=0\frac{dy}{dx} [c]=0dxdy​[c]=0

Identity derivative

  • Let f(x)=xf(x)=xf(x)=x, then dydx[x]=1\frac{dy}{dx} [x]=1dxdy​[x]=1
  • (If f(x)f(x)f(x) equals itself, than the derivative of xxx is 111)

Power rule

  • Let f(x)=xnf(x)=x^nf(x)=xn, where n is an unsigned (positive) integer, dydx[xn]=nxn−1\frac{dy}{dx} [x^n ]=nx^{n−1}dxdy​[xn]=nxn−1

Constant multiple rule

  • Let f(x)f(x)f(x) be a function and ccc a constant, then dydx[c∗f(x)]=c∗f′(x)\frac{dy}{dx} [c∗f(x)]=c∗f\prime(x)dxdy​[c∗f(x)]=c∗f′(x)

Sum and difference rule

  • Let f(x)f(x)f(x) and g(x)g(x)g(x) be functions, then dydx[f(x)±g(x)]=f′(x)±g′(x)\frac{dy}{dx} [f(x)±g(x)]=f^\prime (x)±g^\prime (x)dxdy​[f(x)±g(x)]=f′(x)±g′(x)

Product Rule

  • dydx[f(x)∗g(x)]=f′(x)g(x)+f(x)g′(x)\frac{dy}{dx} [f(x)∗g(x)]=f^\prime (x)g(x)+f(x)g\prime(x)dxdy​[f(x)∗g(x)]=f′(x)g(x)+f(x)g′(x)

Quotient Rule

  • dydx[f(x)g(x)]=f′(x)g(x)−f(x)g′(x)g(x)2\frac{dy}{dx} [\frac{f(x)}{g(x)} ]=\frac{f^\prime (x)g(x)−f(x)g\prime(x)}{g(x)^2}dxdy​[g(x)f(x)​]=g(x)2f′(x)g(x)−f(x)g′(x)​

Sine Rule

  • dydx[sin⁡u]=cos⁡u∗u′\frac{dy}{dx} [\sin{u}]=\cos{u}∗u\primedxdy​[sinu]=cosu∗u′

Cosine Rule

  • dydx[cos⁡u]=−sin⁡(u)∗u′\frac{dy}{dx} [\cos{u} ]=−\sin({u})∗u^\primedxdy​[cosu]=−sin(u)∗u′

Tangent Rule

  • dydx[tan⁡(u)]=sec⁡2(u)\frac{dy}{dx} [\tan(u) ]=\sec^2(u)dxdy​[tan(u)]=sec2(u)

Secant Rule

  • dydx[sec⁡(x)]=sec⁡(x)tan⁡(x)\frac{dy}{dx} [\sec(x) ]=\sec(x)\tan(x)dxdy​[sec(x)]=sec(x)tan(x)

Cosecant Rule

  • dydx[sec⁡(x)]=−sec⁡(x)sec⁡(x)\frac{dy}{dx} [\sec(x) ]=−\sec(x)\sec(x)dxdy​[sec(x)]=−sec(x)sec(x)

Cotangent Rule

  • dydx[sec⁡(x)]=−sec⁡2(x)\frac{dy}{dx} [\sec(x) ]=−\sec^2(x)dxdy​[sec(x)]=−sec2(x)

Euler's Number Rule

  • dydx[eu]=eu∗u′\frac{dy}{dx} [e^u ]=e^u∗u\primedxdy​[eu]=eu∗u′

Exponent Rule

  • dydx[f(x)g(x)]=g(x)∗f(x)g(x)−1∗f′(x)\frac{dy}{dx} [f(x)^{g(x)} ]=g(x)∗f(x)^{g(x)−1}∗f\prime(x)dxdy​[f(x)g(x)]=g(x)∗f(x)g(x)−1∗f′(x)
  • Works w/ radicals too

Function Rule (or polynomials)

  • dydx[f(g(x))]=f′(g(x))∗g′(x)\frac{dy}{dx} [f(g(x))]=f^\prime (g(x))∗g^\prime (x)dxdy​[f(g(x))]=f′(g(x))∗g′(x)

Log Rules

  • dydx[ln⁡(x)]=1/x,x>0\frac{dy}{dx} [\ln(x) ]=1/x, x>0dxdy​[ln(x)]=1/x,x>0
  • dydx[ln⁡(∣x∣)]=1/x,x≠0\frac{dy}{dx} [\ln(|x|) ]=1/x, x≠0dxdy​[ln(∣x∣)]=1/x,x=0
  • dydx[ln⁡(g(x))]=1g(x)∗g′(x)=g′(x)g(x)\frac{dy}{dx} [\ln(g(x)) ]=\frac{1}{g(x)} ∗g^\prime (x)=\frac{g^\prime (x)}{g(x)}dxdy​[ln(g(x))]=g(x)1​∗g′(x)=g(x)g′(x)​
  • dydx[ln⁡(c∗x)]=1/x\frac{dy}{dx} [\ln(c∗x) ]=1/xdxdy​[ln(c∗x)]=1/x (ccc is a constant)
  • dydx[ln⁡(xn)]=nx\frac{dy}{dx} [\ln(x^n ) ]=\frac{n}{x}dxdy​[ln(xn)]=xn​

General Exponential/Log Rule

  • dydx[bx]=bx∗ln(b)\frac{dy}{dx} [b^x ]=b^x∗ln(b)dxdy​[bx]=bx∗ln(b)
  • dydx[log⁡b(x)]=1/(ln⁡(b))\frac{dy}{dx}[\log_b(x)]=1/(\ln(b))dxdy​[logb​(x)]=1/(ln(b))

Inverse Sine Rule

  • dydx[sin−1(x)]=1/1−x2∗x′,−1<x<1\frac{dy}{dx} [sin^{−1}(x) ]=1/\sqrt{1−x^2 }∗x\prime, −1<x<1dxdy​[sin−1(x)]=1/1−x2​∗x′,−1<x<1

Inverse Cosine Rule

  • dydx[cos⁡−1(x)]=11−x2∗x′,−1<x<1\frac{dy}{dx} [\cos^{−1}(x)]=\frac{1}{\sqrt{1−x^2}}∗x\prime, −1<x<1dxdy​[cos−1(x)]=1−x2​1​∗x′,−1<x<1

Inverse Tangent Rule

  • dydx[tan⁡−1(x)]=11+x2∗x′\frac{dy}{dx} [\tan^{-1}(x)]=\frac{1}{1+x^2}∗x\primedxdy​[tan−1(x)]=1+x21​∗x′

Inverse Secant Rule

  • ddx[sec−1(x)]={1/xx2−1∗x′, x>1−1xx2−1∗x′, x<−1\frac{d}{dx}[sec^{-1}(x)]=\begin{cases} \frac{1}/{x\sqrt{x^2-1}}*x\prime &\text{, } x>1 \\ -\frac{1}{x\sqrt{x^2-1}}*x\prime &\text{, } x<-1 \end{cases}dxd​[sec−1(x)]={/1​xx2−1​∗x′−xx2−1​1​∗x′​, x>1, x<−1​
  • dydx[sec−1(x)]=1∣x∣x2−1,∣x∣>1\frac{dy}{dx} [sec^{-1}(x) ]=\frac{1}{|x| \sqrt{x^2−1}}, |x| > 1dxdy​[sec−1(x)]=∣x∣x2−1​1​,∣x∣>1

Inverse Cosecant Rule

  • dydx[sec⁡−1(x)]=−1∣x∣x2−1∗x′\frac{dy}{dx} [\sec^{-1}(x) ]=−\frac{1}{|x| \sqrt{x^2−1}}∗x\primedxdy​[sec−1(x)]=−∣x∣x2−1​1​∗x′

Inverse Cotangent Rule

  • dydx[sec⁡−1(x)]=−11+x2∗x′\frac{dy}{dx} [\sec^{−1}(x) ]=-\frac{1}{1+x^2}∗x\primedxdy​[sec−1(x)]=−1+x21​∗x′

General Inverse Trig Derivative

  • dydx[trig−1(g(x))]=11−(g(x))2∗g′(x)\frac{dy}{dx} [trig^{−1} (g(x))]=\frac{1}{\sqrt{1−(g(x))^2}}∗g\prime(x)dxdy​[trig−1(g(x))]=1−(g(x))2​1​∗g′(x)

General Inverse Function Derivative

  • dydx[f−1(x)]=1f′(f−1(x))\frac{dy}{dx} [f^{-1} (x)]=\frac{1}{f\prime(f^{-1} (x))}dxdy​[f−1(x)]=f′(f−1(x))1​
  • (f(x)=y∧f−1(y)=x)→dydx[f−1(y)]=1(f′(x))(f(x)=y \land f^{-1} (y)=x) \rarr \frac{dy}{dx} [f^{-1} (y)]=\frac1{(f\prime(x))}(f(x)=y∧f−1(y)=x)→dxdy​[f−1(y)]=(f′(x))1​
